block.p: LEAD: The Mentor Graphics Corporation said today that it will buy $300 million worth of Sun Microsystems Inc.'s Sparc computers over the next three years. Mentor, based in Beaverton, Ore., will resell the Sun computers bundled with its software, which is primarily used to design chips and printed circuit boards.

The Mentor Graphics Corporation said today that it will buy $300 million worth of Sun Microsystems Inc.'s Sparc computers over the next three years. Mentor, based in Beaverton, Ore., will resell the Sun computers bundled with its software, which is primarily used to design chips and printed circuit boards.
Sun shares closed today at $33, up $1.375, in over-the-counter trading; Mentor shares closed at $24.25, down 25 cents.
Mountainview, Calif., said the National Association of Securities Dealers had agreed to buy 29 Sparc computers to help monitor trade activity on the over-the-counter market.

Mentor announced earlier this year that it would adapt its software to run on the Sun machines. Mentor had exclusively sold its software for equipment made by Apollo Computer Inc., but Sun's share of the work-station market has eclipsed Apollo's.
